result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert J Prondzinski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber if approved by jail administration. 
Court will not allow Electronic Monitoring.

miscConds.notes: Pay costs including the Domestic Abuse and DNA surcharges.  Any bond monies to be applied to the fine/costs and balance due during the period of probation.

No violent or abusive contact with Cynthia Makuski. 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Engage in any other counseling or assessments as requested by the Department.
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations, if there are any.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert J Prondzinski

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Robert J Prondzinski in court with attorney Eric Sheets. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
9:19 a.m.  Court calls the case. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of:  NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).
State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Sheets makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes statements to the Court. 
Court questions the defendant. 

BY THE COURT:
40 days jail - STAYED -
1 day credit
Huber if approved by jail administration. 
Court will not allow Electronic Monitoring. 
Placed on probation for a period of 12 months: 
No violent or abusive contact with Cynthia Makuski. 
Pay costs including the Domestic Abuse and DNA surcharges. 
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations, if there are any. 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Engage in any other counseling or assessments as requested by the Department. 
Any bond monies to be applied to the fine/costs and balance due during the period of probation. 

Court advises of Post-Conviction relief.
for Attorney to Appear and Act

Defendant Robert J Prondzinski in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Defendant makes statements to the Court. 
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/Public Defender representation.
Court enters NOT GUILTY plea on the defendant's behalf. 

BY THE COURT:  Bond Continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 09:30 am.
CAP Services Personalized Family Safety Plan filed by: C. Makuski - wants contact

$150 cash bond: Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.   Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  Cynthia Makusi  *Unless the victim goes to CAP Services to get a Family Safety Plan and then files the form with the Clerk of Courts and District Attorney.  If filed, then no abusive contact with the above named.

1:16 p.m.
DA Case #15PT1057
d.o.b. 12-08-1977
ADA Cousins appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Cousins states facts for anticipated charges of Disorderly Conduct.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. 
State requests a $150 cash bond  with conditions as stated. 
Defendant requests sig bond.

BTC: $150 cash bond: Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.   Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  Cynthia Makusi  *Unless the victim goes to CAP Services to get a Family Safety Plan and then files the form with the Clerk of Courts and District Attorney.  If filed, then no abusive contact with the above named.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:   06-15-2015 @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 3
